Name: Statue of Nesptah Holding Osiris Figure
Description: The statue of Nesptah, son of Montuemhat, is holding a standing figure of Osiris. Nesptah wears a short wig and a headdress decorated with horizontal stripes on the forehead and vertical ones on the sides. The headdress reaches his shoulders, leaving his ears uncovered. The man is dressed in a long pleated kilt that falls in a triangular fold. Osiris, in the shape of a mummy, wears his usual Atef crown and holds his typical "Was", or prosperity, and "Djed", or stability, scepters of kingship.
